meanings.definition: In a way that makes someone feel frightened or nervous
meanings.sent1: She looked intimidatingly at the dark alley ahead.
meanings.sent2: The large dog barked intimidatingly at the strangers.
meanings.sent3: The tiny kitten tried to act intimidatingly towards the big dog.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered intimidatingly on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house loomed intimidatingly over the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: In a way that is likely to make someone feel less confident or willing to do something
meanings.sent1: The strict teacher spoke intimidatingly to the students.
meanings.sent2: The high expectations set by the coach were intimidatingly high.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel chattered intimidatingly at the birds stealing its nuts.
meanings.sent5: The mountain peak rose intimidatingly above the clouds.
